modules.description: Provides a function to retrieve boot parameters as an array, with target-specific implementations for Xen, Solo5, and Unix. Operates on strings and arrays, handling flattened parameter strings where whitespace is not supported. Used to access kernel configuration data during unikernel initialization.

Returns a list of command-line arguments passed to the application. Operates on strings and arrays, extracting and formatting boot-time variables. Used to access and process kernel command-line parameters in MirageOS environments.

Parses a single string into a list of substrings by splitting on whitespace, respecting backslash-escaped characters. Works with raw string input to produce a safe, tokenized representation. Used to process command-line arguments or configuration strings in a controlled manner.

Provides a function to retrieve the command line arguments passed to the unikernel, excluding the binary name. Works with string data to expose kernel boot parameters. Used to access configuration values set at startup for runtime processing.
